elements.title: Haku Rakuten (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Noh play Haku Rakuten is parodied in a woodblock print (pictured)?

elements.title: Mary V. R. Thayer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Mary V. R. Thayer was briefly arrested on suspicion of spying after abandoning a 1929 business trip in the Soviet Union to explore the Caucasus?

elements.title: conidiobolomycosis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the fungal infection conidiobolomycosis mainly affects people living in tropical areas but was first reported in horses in Texas?

elements.title: James Sofronas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that racing driver James Sofronas worked as a salesman for a technology company to buy the Nissan NX 2000 required for his first competitive race?

elements.title: Nature Always Wins (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a track on Maxïmo Park's album Nature Always Wins is about Nick Alexander, the band's former merchandiser who was killed in the Bataclan concert hall attack?

elements.title: Alfred Koerppen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Alfred Koerppen, who taught music theory and composition at the Musikhochschule Hannover, wrote the text and music of a 1951 opera after Virgil?

elements.title: Silver Deer of Bilge Khan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Silver Deer of Bilge Khan, a 7th-century artifact, is recognized by the Mongolian government as being of "invaluable heritage"?

elements.title: Torreya Guardians (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Torreya Guardians are trying to save the critically endangered North American conifer Torreya taxifolia from extinction?
